comments.content: Can't find a match but don't think it's a font, rather a custom lettering for the movie. My suggestion would be to start with [Mostra Nuova](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822144734/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/mostra-nuova) mixing Heavy and Heavy Alternate C to get a closer /C. But that would let a lot of work...

Another couple of fonts that could be taken to the butcher shop to make DELICATESSEN are Mr Earl Bold BT [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/mister-earl/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822144734/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/mister-earl/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/mister-earl/") and Bundle of Joy NF [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/bundle-of-joy-nf/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822144734/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/bundle-of-joy-nf/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/bundle-of-joy-nf/")  
Don

Thinking outside the box:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822144734im_/http:/typophile.com/files/WigwagBoldWidth60pct_4389.jpg)
  
This is Wigwag compressed to 60% width. Less editing needed than some of the other candidates. [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/parkinson/wigwag/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822144734/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/parkinson/wigwag/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/parkinson/wigwag/")  
Don

FF Turmino Black:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/turmino/ot-black/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822144734/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/turmino/ot-black/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/turmino/ot-black/")

Modify the shape and counter in the D, alter the shapes of the C, A, and S, and you've got a pretty good match.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822144734im_/http:/typophile.com/files/FFTurminoOTBlack_5815.jpg)

Good find Kevin. FF Turmino Black has fairly close proportions and weight to the DELICATESSEN letters. Here it is with the changes you mentioned plus other tinkering.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822144734im_/http:/typophile.com/files/TurminoBlackEditedSM_5130.jpg)
 This is not very difficult to replicate.  
Don

Nice work, Don.

I was pleasantly surprised to find Turmino Black. The original title was hand drawn, and was based on old German advertising posters of the 1910s and 1920s.
